studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Increased the potential sample size from 2850 up to 4000 patients based on event accrual projections.
Refined NT-proBNP thresholds based on LVEF categories and Atrial Fibrillation status.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Accumulated blinded data suggested a slower accrual of primary outcome events than originally projected.
To ensure the trial is adequately powered to achieve the required number of primary outcome events.

studyChanges.afterText: Approximately 2850 randomised. If the accumulated blinded data suggests a slower accrual of primary outcome events... the number of patients randomised may be increased up to 4000.
studyChanges.summary: Increased maximum sample size and extended recruitment period.

studyChanges.afterText: Elevated NT-proBNP at Visit 1... analysed at the Central Laboratory (with specific tiers for EF 36-40, 31-35, and ≤30, adjusted for AF).
studyChanges.summary: Detailed tiered NT-proBNP inclusion requirements based on Ejection Fraction and AF status.

studyChanges.afterText: Ketoacidosis... diagnosis of ketoacidosis in these patients can be based on arterial pH ≤7.30, serum bicarbonate levels <15 and measurement of serum beta-hydroxybutrate levels.
studyChanges.summary: Added specific diagnostic criteria for ketoacidosis as an Adverse Event of Special Interest (AESI).
